I have gone back and forth on the issue of throwing away tests. This week, =
I'm comfortable with the idea. If the test were so important, I'd remember =
it. Maybe when I change the implementation from trivial to nontrivial, the =
nontrivial implementation is radically different and I need different tests=
. The old tests make me feel too confident for no reason, so I throw them a=
way.

Take care.
